messages.title: Dear Voter,
messages.content: After 12 years in the Army and 8 years in marketing I became an Ordained Baptist Minister. Locally I served at the Pilgrims Hospice for 7 years in a multi faith role. For 16 years I have been supporting families here, often in difficult times. I served 2 years as Thanet District Council Chairman overseeing creditable improvements and worked with the Army to bring the PWRR 'Tigers' to Manston. I believe my life experience and knowledge of our local community makes me well placed to serve this constituency as your next MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Immigration system fair for all; Border and coastal security reinstated.
Recruit 20,000 Police and 20,000 Soldiers; Rebuild our Armed Forces.
Fund 20,000 nurses and 10,000 GPs; Scrap hospital parking fees.
One legal system for all; Defending hard-won equality and free speech.
Full Brexit; Abolish the House of Lords; English Parliament; Proportional Representation.

issues.brexitEurope: Remaining in the crumbling European Union
issues.defence: Recruit 20,000 Police and 20,000 Soldiers; Rebuild our Armed Forces.
issues.governance: Proportional Representation; Abolish the House of Lords; English Parliament
issues.health: Fund 20,000 nurses and 10,000 GPs; Scrap hospital parking fees.
issues.immigration: CUT IMMIGRATION; Immigration system fair for all; Border and coastal security reinstated.

community.content: Selling off our housing stock to foreign buyers

personalStories.story: After 12 years in the Army and 8 years in marketing I became an Ordained Baptist Minister. Locally I served at the Pilgrims Hospice for 7 years in a multi-faith role. For 16 years I have been supporting families here, often in difficult times. I served 2 years as Thanet District Council Chairman overseeing creditable improvements and worked with the Army to bring the PWRR 'Tigers' to Manston.

examples: Selling off our housing stock to foreign buyers
Remaining in the crumbling European Union
Jeremy Corbyn and his Labour party are in a death spiral. They no longer represent ordinary, hard-working people and are run by an Islington-based clique.
